edu.northwestern.at.utils.corpuslinguistics.inflector.pluralizer
Class RuleBasedPluralizer

java.lang.Object
  edu.northwestern.at.utils.corpuslinguistics.inflector.pluralizer.RuleBasedPluralizer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Pluralizer
Direct Known Subclasses:
EnglishPluralizer
public class RuleBasedPluralizer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Pluralizer

A Pluralizer implemented using an ordered list of WordRules.

You may specify a fallback Pluralizer that is invoked when none of the rules match. This allows you to override some rules of another Pluralizer.

This class preserves leading and trailing whitespace, so individual rules don't need to explicitly handle whitespace.

Case is also preserved -- that is, the output of all uppercase input is automatically uppercased, and the output of titlecase input is automatically titlecased. This means rules can act in a case-insensitive manner.

Original code written by Tom White under the Apache v2 license. Modified by Philip R. Burns for integration into MorphAdorner.

Constructor Detail

RuleBasedPluralizer

public RuleBasedPluralizer()
Construct a pluralizer with an empty list of rules.

RuleBasedPluralizer

public RuleBasedPluralizer(java.util.List<WordRule> rules,
                           java.util.Locale locale)
Construct a pluralizer with a list of rules.

Parameters:
rules - The rules to apply, in order.
locale - The locale specifying the language of the pluralizer.

A noop pluralizer is used as the fall back pluralizer when none of the specified rules applies.

RuleBasedPluralizer

public RuleBasedPluralizer(java.util.List<WordRule> rules,
                           java.util.Locale locale,
                           Pluralizer fallbackPluralizer)
Construct a pluralizer with a list of rules and a backup pluralizer.

Parameters:
rules - The rules to apply, in order.
locale - The locale specifying the language of the pluralizer.
fallbackPluralizer - The pluralizer to use when no rules match.

The fall back pluralizer is invoked when none of the specified rules applies.

pluralizeInternal

protected java.lang.String pluralizeInternal(java.lang.String nounOrPronoun)
Apply list of rules to a noun or pronoun.

Parameters:
nounOrPronoun - Singular noun or pronoun.
Returns:
Plural form of the noun or pronoun, or null when no rule matches.

postProcess

protected java.lang.String postProcess(java.lang.String trimmedWord,
                                       java.lang.String pluralizedWord)
Fix case of pluralized word.

Parameters:
trimmedWord - The input word, with leading and trailing whitespace removed.
pluralizedWord - The pluralized word.
Returns:
The pluralizedWord after processing.

If trimmedWord is all uppercase, then pluralizedWord is uppercased. If trimmedWord is titlecase, then pluralizedWord is titlecased.
